key_insight: A panoramic metric-depth foundation model trained on a large, mixed dataset (real + synthetic + web) and a data-in-the-loop pipeline can generalize across diverse scene distances and domains for accurate panoramic depth estimation.
problem_solved: Bridges domain and scale gaps in panoramic depth estimation so a single model can produce reliable metric depth across indoor/outdoor scenes and near/far ranges without per-dataset specialization.
method: Assemble a large-scale, mixed dataset by combining public datasets, high-quality UE5 simulator data, text-to-image synthetic panoramas, and real web panoramas.
Apply a three-stage pseudo supervision / domain-reduction pipeline (data-in-the-loop) to reduce synthetic/real and indoor/outdoor domain gaps during training.
Train a panoramic-capable foundation model that outputs metric depth for equirectangular panoramas with multi-scale supervision to improve generalization across scene distances.
impact: Provides practitioners a robust, general-purpose panoramic depth model and data-construction strategy that reduces the need for scene-specific labeling—beneficial for AR/VR, robotics, mapping, and large-scale 3D scene understanding.
visual_elements: Data-source collage: icons/tiles showing public datasets, UE5 simulator, text-to-image generation, and web panoramas feeding into a single dataset.

Before/after qualitative map: side-by-side panoramic RGB and predicted metric depth for indoor and outdoor scenes across near/far distances.

paper_title: Depth Any Panoramas: A Foundation Model for Panoramic Depth Estimation
paper_authors: Xin Lin, Meixi Song, Dizhe Zhang, Wenxuan Lu, Haodong Li
